title: François Bayrou, a longstanding Macron ally rewarded at last
summary: The leader of the centrist MoDem party, one of Emmanuel Macron's oldest political allies, was appointed prime minister on Friday. He had dreamed of taking the French government's reins for decades.

title: Moody's downgrades France credit rating to Aa3
summary: The new decision comes after parliament ousted Michel Barnier's government in a historic no-confidence vote following a standoff over an austerity budget.

title: French far right ready to give new PM François Bayrou a chance
summary: Marine Le Pen has respect for the centrist, who has her defended her right to run in elections in the past. While they share common battles, such as proportional representation, their disagreements are far more numerous, notably on Europe.

title: Ukraine must 'provide soldiers,' says NATO representative in Kyiv
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Patrick Turner, who coordinates Ukraine's military support, calls on the country to find the troops it lacks.

title: French court jails 3 rugby players for 12 to 14 years over gang rape
summary: Irishman Denis Coulson, 30, and Frenchman Loick Jammes, 30, were both sentenced to 14 years behind bars and New Zealander Rory Grice, 34, received 12 for the 2017 gang rape of a student at a Bordeaux area hotel.

title: 'Say Nothing' on Disney+: The personal tragedies of Northern Ireland's Troubles
summary: Adapted from Patrick Radden Keefe's bestselling book, the new series covers the three-decade-long conflict with rigor and panache.

title: US military flies American released from Syrian prison to Jordan, officials say
summary: Travis Timmerman, 29, was detained after he crossed into Syria while on a Christian pilgrimage from a mountain along the eastern Lebanese town of Zahle in June.

title: McKinsey to pay $650 million to settle US criminal case on opioids
summary: Consulting giant McKinsey & Company conspired with Purdue Pharma to 'aid and abet the misbranding of prescription drugs,' according to a US Department of Justice document.

title: Influencers, bot accounts and illegal ads: The troubling interference campaign that annulled Romania's election
summary: A vast influence operation, which was well-financed and partly run from Poland, sought to manipulate the Romanian presidential election, which has been annulled by the Constitutional Court.

title: Bird strike disables a jetliner engine and forces an emergency landing at NYC's JFK airport
summary: The pilot of the North Carolina-bound American Airlines aircraft radioed to the control tower during Thursday's emergency and was able to land safely at JFK around 11 minutes later after initially taking off from neighboring LaGuardia Airport in Queens. Airline officials said none of the 190 passengers and six crew members were injured.

title: Brazil's Lula risks 'Biden effect' after hospitalization
summary: The 79-year-old Brazilian president's hospitalization has sparked comparisons with his American counterpart and reignited talk about his succession, and even his ability to continue leading Brazil.

title: Ukraine must 'provide soldiers,' says NATO representative in Kyiv
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Patrick Turner, who coordinates Ukraine's military support, calls on the country to find the troops it lacks.

title: Russian banker Andrei Kostin: 'Russia is the most sanctioned country in the world, of course there are effects on our economy'
summary: The head of Russia's second-largest bank VTB, who is reputedly close to President Vladimir Putin, tells Le Monde in an interview that the Russian economy is 'in good shape.' He does admit, however, that high inflation and massive interest rate hikes are weighing on the banking sector.

title: Syria: Video shows summary execution of Assad regime henchmen
summary: Le Monde has located a video showing the execution of two prisoners accused of being henchmen of the deposed regime. The context suggests that it was filmed as part of the recent conquest of the country by Islamist rebels.

title: Gainsbourg's forgotten canvas
summary: 'The Children in the Park' is one of the few paintings by Serge Gainsbourg that he didn't destroy. It evokes his own childhood and twin sister, whom he never spoke of. Hidden from the public until now, the painting remained for a long time in the home of artist Juliette Gréco, who cherished it. Sold in 2021 to a family of antique dealers, it is now on display in the Gainsbourg museum in Paris.

title: Behind Boris Johnson's charm, a poisoned legacy for the UK
summary: British historian Anthony Seldon gave a harsh assessment of the country's most recent leaders, at a conference on former prime ministers organized by a center-right think-tank.

title: Former US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi injured during Luxembourg trip
summary: The former US Speaker of the House of Representatives is receiving treatment after she was injured on a trip to the country to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the Battle of the Bulge.

title: 'Crown of Thorns' relic returns to Notre-Dame cathedral
summary: The ancient relic, among many saved by firefighters in the 2019 blaze, is returning to the cathedral in Paris.
